item.title: Mathematical Genealogy
item.description: Intro As I near the end of my PhD, my advisor David Kahle submitted my information to the Mathematics Genealogy Project. It was pretty cool to explore the academic lineage I come from — sort of like discovering a scholarly family tree. With some help from ChatGPT, I put together a script to scrape and visualize my genealogy. Since most of the code was generated through a series of back-and-forths with GPT, I won’t walk through every line here, but you can expand the code block below if you’re curious.
